title: Bug 131649 - Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table
description: Designer generates wrong column reference expression for inner table. This design uses a 2-level table to list offices and their employees. So you can construct an expression like this: row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"]. However, this report will not run. So the correct behavior when the user double clicks on "COUNTRY" is to insert rows[0]["COUNTRY"] into the expression. The first index (an integer) to the "rows" array is the 0-based index of the nested table which contains the data set (0 = outermost table, 1 = first-level inner table, etc.).
OB: The designer generates incorrect column reference expressions when using a 2-level table. It attempts to reference columns as if they were in the outermost table.
EB: The expected behavior is that the report designer should correctly determine the index number by considering the nesting levels of all tables and generate the appropriate column reference expressions.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a 2-level table design listing offices and their employees.
2. Construct an expression using column references, such as row["FIRSTNAME"] + " " + row["LASTNAME"] + " / " + row["OFFICECODE"].
3. Attempt to run the report.
4. Double-click on the "COUNTRY" column to insert a reference, expecting rows[0]["COUNTRY"] to be inserted.
